title: 3. A breach of Article 5(2) of the Principal Regulations shall be an offence
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Control of Dogs (Amendment)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Control of Dogs (Amendment) 

Regulations 2023.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited control dog (amendment) regulation 2023

title: 3. A breach of Article 5(2) of the Principal Regulations shall be an offence
heading: 2. (1) These Regulations shall come into operation on 1st December 2023.
text_raw:
2. (1) These Regulations shall come into operation on 1st December 2023. 

(2) In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Control of Dogs 

Regulations 1998 (S.I. No. 442 of 1998).
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation shall come operation 1st december 2023 (2) regulation principal regulation mean control dog regulation 1998 (s.i no 442 1998)

title: 3. A breach of Article 5(2) of the Principal Regulations shall be an offence
heading: 3. A breach of Article 5(2) of the Principal Regulations shall be an offence
text_raw:
3. A breach of Article 5(2) of the Principal Regulations shall be an offence 

to which section 28(1) applies.
text_norm: 3 breach article 5(2) principal regulation shall offence section 28(1) applies

title: 3. A breach of Article 5(2) of the Principal Regulations shall be an offence
heading: 4. The Control of Dogs Regulations 1998 (S.I. No. 442/1990) are amended
text_raw:
4. The Control of Dogs Regulations 1998 (S.I. No. 442/1990) are amended 

by the substitution of the following Regulation for Regulation 10: 

“10. The prescribed amounts for the purpose of section 28(1) of the Act 
are as follows: 

(a) 

€150, in respect of an offence referred to in section 27(1)(a), 

(b) €300, in respect of an offence of failing to comply with section 

9(1), referred to in section 27(1)(b), 

(c) 

€250, in respect of an offence of failing to comply with section 
10, referred to in section 27(1)(b), 

(d) €150, in respect of an offence of failing to comply with section 

13, referred to in section 27(1)(b), 

(e) 

(f) 

€150, in respect of an offence referred to in section 27(1)(c), 

€300, in respect of an offence being a breach of Article 5, referred 
to in section 27(1)(f) and 

(g) €200, in respect of an offence being a breach of Article 6(1) or 

(2), referred to in section 27(1)(f).”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

9 November, 2023. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Rural and Community Development. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 14th November, 2023.
